WEBHOOK.TITLE: Webhook
WEBHOOK.SEARCH_404: There are no items matching this query.
WEBHOOK.SIDEBAR_TXT:
Webhooks

Webhooks help you keep an eye on essential activities in your Chatwoot account, like a new message or conversation being created. You can create multiple webhooks for your account, each with its unique URL.

You can manage your webhooks from this page or create new ones using the

button.

Open the Webhooks handbook in another tab for a helping hand.

LIST.404: There are no webhooks configured for this account.

HELP_TEXT.TITLE: Using Slack integration
HELP_TEXT.BODY:
Chatwoot will sync your incoming conversations to your Slack workplace's 'customer-conversations' channel.

When you reply to a conversation thread in this channel, Chatwoot will create a response back to the customer. To create private notes instead of replies, start your message with 'note:'.

If the replier on Slack has an agent profile in Chatwoot under the same email, the replies will be associated accordingly. However, if the replier doesn't have an associated agent profile, the replies will be made from the bot profile.

DASHBOARD_APPS.TITLE: Dashboard Apps
DASHBOARD_APPS.SIDEBAR_TXT:
Dashboard Apps

With Dashboard Apps, you can integrate third-party applications directly into your dashboard, providing agents with valuable context. This way, you have ready access to information such as user details, order history, payment information, etc.

When you embed your application in the dashboard, your application receives the context of the conversation and contact as a window event. To receive this context, implement a listener for the message event on your page.

You can manage your existing dashboard apps from this page or add a new one using the 'Add a dashboard app' button.

Open the Dashboard Apps handbook in another tab for a helping hand.
DASHBOARD_APPS.DESCRIPTION: With Dashboard Apps, you can easily integrate third-party applications directly into your Chatwoot dashboard, providing agents with valuable context about customers. This can include information such as user details, order history, payment information, and more. It's a great way to streamline your support processes and provide a better experience for both your agents and your customers.
